intro: Cynorkis pulchra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The leaves are typically velvety and dark green, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its ability to thrive in indoor conditions and its long blooming period. Cynorkis pulchra prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
